That's how much I love these characters. These strikingly beautiful and talented actors and actresses won my heart again.

reviewText: This movie brought in the element of real life. The courageous fight to live even with the knowledge of impending death due to her cancer. It demonstrated how filled we are with our own problems and life 's decisions that we neglect to stop and look at what is also truly happening in the life of those we most love and care about. The need for the ill one not to share the distress and loneliness of her approaching death with her closest friends in an effort to keep happiness within the group. To realize that each day and moment in time is so very precious. This movie was very thought provoking, happy and sad. This movie put a face on the reality of life. Very well written, acted and highly recommended.
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: Best Man, Best Movie. Call it what you want; it is very well put together. Excellent performances and great chemistry!

reviewText: I know situations like these happen in real life, but there is a such thing as keeping it TOO real when it comes to movies-espicially a holiday movie. I'm glad that I did not pay to see this when it came out in the theater.....depressing. Sometimes we enjoy movies for the fantasy and because they make us dream and aspire to be better than what or who we are.(Hint: Black people dream too.) People always joke about messy family holidays in real life, but for my family we usually save that drama for other times. The cursing and bad behavior in the presence of children was the worst. They should have titled this movie "Worst Christmas".
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: A simply beautiful joyful holiday film. Morris Chestnut superb acting along with a hostof other talented actors. Great film.
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: This is truly a remarkable movie with plenty of laughs, pathos, and more than a bit of sadness.  All of the characters from the 1999 film "The Best Man,"  are present and each character  has a time to shine in the movie.  Terence Howard is very funny and his character shows the most growth from the 1999 original.  Monica Calhoun is outstanding as the ill Mother of three children and wife to Morris Chestnut.  Several of the characters are going through trials, most of all Taye Diggs character and Sanaa Lathan and Julian (Murch) and wife, Regina Hall.  The movie ends on a positive note but there is truly a very sad part towards the end. There is plenty of cattiness and backbiting between the women and the men and it brings a clarity to their personalities and backgrounds.  Sanaa Lathan who was not in the first movie as much has a much more pivotal role in this one.It took 14 years for the Director Malcolm D. Lee to make this sequel but I must say that it was well worth the wait and the actors have grown as stars.  What a great ensemble cast.  The music in the movie also wonderful.  I really enjoyed this movie and it is one that I would watch again and again.  A sequel as good as the original.  How amazing!Watch this movie, recommend it to others and watch it with friends and be prepared to laugh a lot and also to cry.  Try not to hold back the tears let them flow.  Then watch it again.  These women look better in their forties then they did in their twenties and thirties. Also the fashions look spectacular.
summary: A Rare Re Make  as Good as the Original
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: Funny, heartfelt and I enjoyed it from start to finish.  Terrence Howard was super FUNNY in some scenes.  Not going to say which, because I'm not going to spoil it for those who haven't watched it yet.I recommend this movie 100% and guarantee you will not be disappointed.

reviewText: I went to the movies to see this and I wasn't expecting what I got.  Nobody on my job would talk to me about it, they just said to go see it.  I did.  Didn't expect to happen what did.  I laughed, I shed tears, it just took me there, throughout all the characters ups and downs.  It was just that type of flick.  In the end, it was about friendship.  No matter who had who's back and throughout all the leftover angers that surfaced upon arrivals, in the end, it was the friendships that STILL remained, and that's was the most important part of this movie.  From what I understand, this is a trilogy, so there is a part three.  I hope that it comes out this winter, cause if they wait as long as they did this one, I may have to rent the first and second, just to remember who did what to whom.
summary: A movie about friendship...through the good and bad times.
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: An excellent movie!
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: The Best Man Holiday movie writer and director Malcolm D. Lee (Spike Lee's cousin) waited 14 years to do a sequel to The Best Man, 1999 of an outrageously fresh comedy of African-American love and backbiting film displaying wit, verve, spark, and surprise. The Best Man Holiday extends portraying character stories and filling in blanks left in the original, The Best Man. Malcolm D. Lee raises the stakes on characters cradling to their bosoms, adding a surprising amount of tragedy with a richer emotional palette. The Best Man Holiday sequel to The Best Man ensues Malcolm D. Lee is a better motion picture writer than well-known Tyler Perry.The Best Man Holiday stars somewhat black ensemble cast, made with talented and likeable actors such as Taye Diggs, Morris Chestnut, Terrence Howard, Harold Perrineau, Nia Long, Regina Hall, and Sanaa Lathan, Melissa De Sousa, Monica Calhoun, Eddie Cibrian and among others. Lance Sullivan (Morris Chestnut) is now looking toward retirement, while Harper Stewart (Taye Diggs) is getting the boot from his professorship and a flat pan from his publishers in response to his latest manuscript. On top of this, Robyn (Sanaa Lathan), Harper's wife, is eight months pregnant, giving Harper reason to keep her in the dark about his troubles. I enjoyed the goofy rendition of New Edition's "Can You Stand the Rain?" of its fun by treating the cheesy lyrics with a certain measure of sincerity. The scant laughs come courtesy of hedonistic Quentin (Terrence Howard) and Julian Murch (Harold Perrineau), who's dealing with a scandalous online video featuring his wife, Candace (Regina Hall). As with the first film, the men indulge an off-putting jealousy in regard to women's sexual histories that Malcolm D. Lee plainly justifies as naturally masculine, and women on the whole here hardly matter outside of the men they're connected to. Even man-eater Shelby (Melissa De Soussa) is defined by her relationships with Julian (Harold Perrineau), her ex, and Quentin (Terrence Howard), her booty call; Jordan (Nia Long), a powerful businesswoman, is only noticeable for stirring up jealousy over Harper (Taye Diggs) and waiting for her new boyfriend, Brian (Eddie Cibrian) to forgive her. This was a great movie and I hope the next sequel does not take as long as 14 years later because t the end of this film Quentin (Terrence Howard) announced he was getting married.
summary: The Best Man Holiday Is An Awe-Inspiring Film
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: I rated this highly because I think American movie goers need, and want to see incredibly successful African-Americans behaving like their "white" super successful counterparts.  From the obviously professional decorated mansion with professional Christmas tree, to the well behaved children behaving like polite, intellection automatons that no ethnic group ever really has, this was a movie about the top percentage of any color, looking, smelling, acting as our myths want them to do.There is a large dose of faith with fortunately is not spoiled by a miracle, and just a few moments of the real emotions felt in any family/friends reunion to prevent artificial diabetes.  All in all, this was a fun movie to rent.
summary: One tenth of one tenth of one percent

reviewText: So this fellow had written a fictitious book inspired by events in his own life... When the old group gathered for a wedding, friends questioned how much of that book was really fiction and how much was actual fact. Oops! That was the premise of "The Best Man" in 1999. Now we have a sequel which takes place 15 years later. And yes, the plot has thickened ...but those old hurts still haven't gone away.Our little bunch has never been so witty or so appealing; the dialogue is racy, raunchy and very, very funny (the delighted audience laughed out loud over and over again). Religion unabashedly plays a big part in the plot and it is used with NO irony or derision, so we see successful middle- class families who attend church, pray together, and raise polite well- mannered children who sing religious songs at family gatherings. This is a feel-good movie with a huge principal cast, so I must limit this to just a few.They are:* Taye Diggs ("Baggage Claim") is Harper, that selfsame author, back on the prowl again in quest of a topic for a new book. Since his first book's middling success, he seems to be in a sophomore slump. (He was The Best Man 15 years ago.)* Sanaa Lathan ("The Cleveland Show") is his wife Robyn, finally due to have a baby (Harper has a low sperm count); problem is, it's breach so she's scheduled for a C-section right after the holidays.* Morris Chestnut ("Ladder 49") is Lance, our Alpha dog: a pro football player, a devoted husband, and a loving father of four (he was the groom 15 years ago). Mr. Chestnut says he doesn't take his shirt off in every film, but I am happy to report that in this one he DOES!* Monica Calhoun (Lots of TV) is Mia, Lance's adored wife and mother to his four children. (She was the bride 15 years ago.) In that crucial football game she watches with her youngsters, we see something that resembles a rugby scrum rather than a traditional football play.* Terrence Howard ("Prisoners") is Quentin, a successful but wayward friend who is always in the middle of everything. I have never seen Mr. Howard so funny!* Nia Long ("House of Lies") is an executive with a successful book publishing company. She wants her author to write a biography of a football player who just happens to be a personal friend.This R-rated outing contains sexual situations (not all the characters are devoted Christians) but stresses the importance of friendship, loyalty and trust. Expect plenty of profanity, lots of anatomical discussions, a girl fight, plus a time to laugh and a time to weep.All in all, this is a nice emotional workout for everyone; that's why movies are made, isn't it? Kudos to writer/director Malcolm D Lee ("Welcome Home, Roscoe Jenkins"). A happy and enthusiastic screening audience exited the theater Tuesday night. I'll notify my JayFlix.net folks when Amazon releases the DVD.
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: This long awaited sequel did not disappoint.The acting was simply world-class, with a story line worthy of the production efforts.Each of the main characters served triple-duty, as they also performed supporting roles, and comic relief.The surprise ending made me want to cry.But, the comedy is what I enjoyed most (*the back-seat scene with Murch & Q had me hollerin'!!!!)

reviewText: In Best Man Holiday,  college friends reunite after 15 years over the Christmas holidays and old feelings both good and bad resurface.I will be the first to say that my wife liked this movie much more than me and seems to me to be a movie for a more female audience.  She liked the multiple stories going on with all the characters and even cried at the end.  For me, the movie was more of a slow mover and I wasn't as emotionally attached to the characters as she was.Both of us agree thought that we thought was too long at over 2 hours and even my wife agreed with me that the story line was predictable.  And although this movie is ok, it follows a storyline that is in familiar territory with its too predictable plot and story that has been done before.
summary: Ok but definately my wife liked better
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: The Best Man (1999): College friends reunite for Lance and Mia's wedding.The Best Man Holiday: These college friends gather at the home of Lance and Mia fifteen years later.Great Cast: Lance - Morris Chestnut, Mia - Monica Calhoun, Harper - Taye Diggs, Robyn - Sanaa Lathan, Jordan - Nia Long, Julian - Harold Perrineau, Candace - Regina Hall, Quentin - Terrance Howard, Shelby - Melissa De Sousa, Brian - Eddie CibrianI heard this was a good movie, so when it aired on HBO I watched (I don't go to the theater as much as I used to and, although I purchase Blu-rays, DVDs and Digital movies from Amazon often, I like to have viewed it first to be sure I want to add it to my collection). The movie trailer looked fun. The movie poster looks fun. I was looking forward to fun. But the movie wasn't as fun to watch as I expected. These friends were dealing with issues that caused quite a bit of drama. And then something came to light that was so disappointing that I kept wondering why the script had to be written this way. I realize this is something that happens in real life, but I didn't see why it had to happen in The Best Man sequel.I did laugh at times - Quentin was the funniest character - but with what happened along with the brief nudity, brief sex scenes and crude humor... I'm sorry, but The Best Man Holiday wasn't as entertaining as I had hoped. I like the actors, though. Again, great cast.
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: This was a good continuation of the original Best Man.  It brought me up-to-date on the characters and also was sad and fun all in one movie.

reviewText: Bring your tissues ...The "Best Man Holiday" was way more than I expected it to be. This is the best movie of the year, in my opinion, but I don't think it's really appropriate for children so don't let the "Holiday" part fool you. This is a very underrated cast of actors and actresses because these people have been in the game for a while now, but they still are not as respected as they should be for the superb thespians that they are. All of the original stars from the first movie have returned, and this one was even better than the first. I saw "The Best Man" fifteen years ago, and I loved it then, so this sequel was long overdue. Stars include: Taye Diggs (Harper), Terrance Howard (Quentin), Morris Chestnut (Lance), Harold Perrineau, Jr (Julian), Nia Long (Jordan), Regina Hall (Candace), Monica Calhoun (Mia), Sanaa Lathan (Robin), Melissa DeSousa (Shelby), and new cast member Eddie Cibrian (Brian). This movie had a deeper story that was way more serious than the first film. It's about pride, loyalty, family, friendship, and understanding that everyone needs somebody at some point in their lives.This movie picks right up where the first one left off, and it brings you up to speed about where these characters have been all this time. I thought that was a clever move because it's clear that a lot has happened. Harper and Robin got married, and are expecting their first child, and clearly you can tell there is some tension in their relationship due to fertility problems as well as financial issues. Candance and Julian have gotten married, and they have two daughters, but Candace still can't escape the consequences of her old profession, and it is brought up a lot that she used to be a stripper, but Shelby is also still a major problem for both of them. Shelby is back, and she's now a reality show television star which is a perfect job for Shelby since she's so overdramatic, but she's also divorced with a daughter of her own now. However, while she continues stirring the pot with Candance and Julian she has bigger problems than she realizes. Jordan, the careerwoman, is back, but this time she has a boyfriend who surprises everybody by being just a little bit lighter than what they were expecting. Jordan's strength, as well as her control issues continue to keep her from obtaining happiness, but she soon realizes that she doesn't have it all. Quentin is still single, lewd, crude, and perhaps one of the realest characters ever, but I was pleased to see that he could also be a serious character with a soft side. Terrance Howard MADE this movie for me! Lastly, Lance and Mia are still married, they now have four children, and Lance is still playing pro-football better than ever, but after a while it becomes clear that they needed to get the old crew back together for a reason, and it is shocking.I absolutely loved the cameos by Anthony Hamilton and Marsha Ambrosius, and if you saw the first film, you'll totally see the significance behind the song they are singing, and if you are familiar with the music you'll love the soundtrack as well because there are great songs from different R&B; stars. I can't say enough good things about this movie. This is a must see!
summary: I laughed ...I cried ...I laughed some more!
Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: This is one of the best sequels ever!  I laughed so hard I cried, and cried so deeply from the most touching moments throughout the film. reviewText: Most sequels disappoint, but this one did not. It depicted the evolution of college relationships quite well...the emotions of experiencing people with whom a life-long bond was created during college days mature and experience life into middle age. It showcases that life sometimes takes hard twists and turns that are largely unpredictable but still must be managed while day-to-day life rocks on. It also exhibits how emotional ties are sometimes life-long and sincerely heart felt. I expect that the next sequel might be when someone's child gets married...another great reason for reunions!
Title: The Best Man Holiday

Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: Best Man Holiday is a story of romance and friendship that will make you laugh, cry and then laugh  a little more. First, let me say that I didn't watch the original Best Man, but you can still follow and enjoy this film regardless of whether you watched the first installation. It stands on its own. In this movie, a group of old college friends reunite. Candace and Julian are a married couple expecting their first child, after years of struggling  to get pregnant. Candace has the added struggle of trying to overcome her past as a stripper. Jordan is a career woman whose control issues are keeping her from the happiness both she and her new boyfriend deserve. Quentin is the comic relief most of the time, but he can also pull of a serious front when the situation calls for it. And of course you have the original couple who started it all. Lance and Mia have been married for years and have four children together. He's a pro-football player living the high life. It all seems like just a fun college reunion, but there is a deeper reason for the get-together and when that secret is revealed it will leave the audience reeling.Best Man Holiday is a fun and emotion packed film. The movie touches on a lot of common issues, including infertility, financial struggles, and overcoming the past.The cast gives a stellar performance. I was really impressed with the movie and I'm surprised I didn't hear more about it. It was never in theaters in my area and its really a shame because this is a movie that deserves to be seen on the big screen.***Complimentary copy received in exchange for an honest review***

Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: I don’t understand all these five star ratings.  The Best Man Holiday was a tired cliché with each and every scene.  I predicted the tear jerker long before it was revealed one of the characters was dying; I should not have been able to guess that one of the characters had to die; but nothing else happened in the movie… so someone had to die!If you like dialog, then this is the movie for you.  If you enjoy watching a movie where people sit around and talk and talk and talk… then give it a five star rating and start the show!  The Best Man Holiday is about these couples who go to the professional athletes home to… talk (of course during the Christmas season).  These people are supposed to all be successful, well-educated young couples.  There is one scene where two of the women get into a fight (yes, I said a physical fight because most successful well-educated people get into brawls regularly) in front of their children, calling each other names that I can’t repeat because Amazon will kick out this review.  What kind of a person goes to someone else’s home and fights in front of children, calling their mother a prostitute?… Wait a minute, there’s more disbelief around the corner:  who invites a group of people to their home and doesn’t bother mentioning that they’re dying?  The guest find out by witnessing her having a coughing fit.  Also, what man invites an ex-best friend into his home (this is the same so called best friend who cheated with his woman in the past), they haven’t talked or gotten over the cheating… but hey, come on over!I couldn’t get past the height of unreality in the plotline.  There are a lot of great stories for African-Americans.  This movie had a lot of great actors, but I felt all of their acting abilities were wasted in this movie.  It tried to be a “feel good” comedy, but for me all the jokes were predictable and lame.  Because I saw the death (and birth) coming, I felt like the writers/directors were attempting to manipulate an emotional reaction out of me… but I couldn’t care about one of the character’s terminal illness because I wasn’t buying the storyline.  This movie is highly forgettable.
summary: Highly predictable and unbelivable. Jokes are lame.  Didn't make me cry, it didn't even come close to it

reviewText: I loved the first "Best Man". Yeppers, totally loved it. "Best man's Holiday"  brings everyone back with a few extras thrown in. We do get a little deeper into the friendship and relationships or all involved as we are all brought back together for Christmas, friends and foes alike. I won't say what the reason is but we do get a lot of terrific performances form all concerned but....this got way too serious and I love all these characters too much and want them to have fun.

Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: "It doesn't feel like Christmas to me." After 15 years of not being together Lance (Chestnut) and Mia (Calhoun) invite all their friends to their house for Christmas. Almost immediately old feelings come up and tensions start to mount. When secrets are revealed the life-long friendships are threatened. Before I start I will admit I have never seen the original movie but the first five minutes seemed like a recap and at no time did I feel lost. I didn't really have any of the character back stories but I caught up pretty fast. As far as this movie goes I wasn't expecting anything all that amazing and was a little hesitant. The main reason for that is because I have never been a Tyler Perry fan (not to sound racist). Even though this isn't one of his movies that is what I was expecting. I'm not sure if it was my low expectations or not but I really enjoyed this much much more then I thought I was going to. The best way to describe this is a version of Why Did I Get Married but funnier and with more like-able characters. This movie is funny but has a real plot and real emotion in it that sucks you in and makes you care about each character. I can't say how it compares to the first one but I can tell you I really did enjoy this one. Overall, a better version of Why Did I Get Married that surprised me as to how much I enjoyed it. I give this a high B+.
summary: I can't say how it compares to the first one but I really did enjoy this one. A better version of Why Did I Get Married.

reviewText: I loved this movie.  It was one of the best movies I've seen in a while.  It was funny and heart-warming. I laughed and I cried, then I laughed and cried again. Quentin (Terrence Howard) was hilarious). I thought the first movie was my favorite, but this one just added to it.  I have seen it twice.  This will definitely be in my collection.  Go see it and you haven't already.
summary: The Best Movie this Holiday Season

Title: The Best Man Holiday

reviewText: I did not see this movie on the big screen but waited for the DVD release and now own it.  I expected some of the same class that was shown in the Best Man.  The only person that I felt was truly disfunctional in the original Best Man was Morris Chestnuts Character who was always threatening and cursing, but lifted up God and struck out at anyone who did not.  What a hypocrite.When I watched the Best Man Holiday on Saturday night, I did not expect the Chestnut Character to still kit the Taye Diggs Character at the beginning of the movie, because they became friendly after the wedding in the first movie.Now, the Morris Chestnut Character seems to be a cracked out running back who is on his last hurahh and a cas of characters who are all having problems except Q.  He always seem to rise to the top like silky cream.  The one suprise was Candice.  in the first movie, she was was the struggling college student trying to make a buck to stay in college, "Murch" married her and in the Holiday Movie, she was a straight street "W" who could not seem to shake the streets.  All of the goins on in the house were done as if children were not present.  Poor Mia....the only conscious-effect in the flick had and was  be killed off with cancer, in order to bring the disfunctionlal group to their senses.  This should have come out as DVS release only, or maybe a late night BET Drama/Comedy.  SMH
